description:
AEON is a Python framework (with Rust backend) for analysis of Boolean networks. It supports a wide range of techniques: (1) Loading/storing networks from SBML-qual, .bnet and .aeon format. (2) Support for partially specified networks with uncertain dynamics. (3) Attractor computation and bifurcation analysis. (4) Model checking and property classification based on (H)CTL. (5) Control and reprogramming using one step/permanent/temporary perturbations.

You can learn more about the usage of AEON in the "examples" folder of the git repository.

link.note: A mirror of the interactive AEON web interface

name: AEON.py

metadata.abstract: Summary: AEON.py is a Python library for the analysis of the long-term behaviour in very large asynchronous Boolean networks. It provides significant computational improvements over the state-of-the-art methods for attract- or detection. Furthermore, it admits the analysis of partially specified Boolean networks with uncertain update functions. It also includes techniques for identifying viable source-target control strategies and the assessment of their robustness with respect to parameter perturbations.
metadata.title: AEON.py: Python library for attractor analysis in asynchronous Boolean networks
